product_name: IMAGE Lawn Weed & Crabgrass Killer Ready-To-Spray
review_title: Image Lawn Weed and Crabgrass Killer Ready!
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First let me say that I was given this product at no cost to me for my honest review. I was very excited to receive and try this product but with the recent heat wave I had to wait....sigh .... A few days had passed and FINALLY I was able to use this product on my yard. This product has a strong smell to it and requires a water hose to attach to it to be able to spray. The bottle itself is light weight and easy to use. I sprayed around my deck to see if it would help kill the weeds and then around the yard for the crabgrass. Within a few hours everything started turning colors from green to brown so this product was doing what it says it does and that is kill the weeds and crabgrass. I would recommend this product... For now I dont have to carry a heavy spay mix around my yard and I can use more by adding my own water since it is concentrated. I can honestly say Yes to giving this product a 5 star review and relax now that the weeds are gone and i didnt have to get on my knees and pull the weeds out!

review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you are looking for a broad range weed killer, this is for you! review_title: I sure does kill Nutsedge....and everything else!
review_text: First tried with exactly the recommended amount of 2.5oz per gallon in a sprayer. Lighly sprayed areas with the nutsedge. As instructed i watered the sprayed areas in 2 days to get the stuff to the roots. Started yellowing in a few days and the rest of the lawn looked fine. Within 2 weeks everything was dead.I figured maybe using a little less may work so I did 2 ounces per gallon...same thing happened.This definitely did not work for me. Btw i live in the north east. Maybe this product doesnt work on my type of grass. And i sorayed it as soon as these devils started to grow. Just info someone that may be of use to others. Good luck.

review_text: I used other weed killers this year. These were effective on most all weeds except Blue grass or Poa annua. I had quite the abundance of poa annua. I understand it takes several weeks to kill this weed. i plan to use this product next year as it addresses most weeds in my area including poa annua. other weed killers do not kill this weed.

product_name: Image Herbicide for St. Augustinegrass & Centipedegrass Concentrate
review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in Texas, and its a battle to keep drought-tolerant St. Augustine grass healthy and weed free. Image Herbicide Consumer Concentrate Southern Lawn Weed Killer for St. Augustinegrass and Centipedegrass. Its designed to kill dandelion, chickweed, clover, dollarweed and spurge. My lawn has had problems with the first three that I listed. Its concentrated, so its important to thoroughly read the extensive directions. The 32 fl. oz. bottle covers 5000 sq. feet. So heres the most important thing that I learned, if you want to kill the weeds and not damage your lawn, it can only be applied in cooler months when the temperature is no higher than 85 degrees Fahrenheit. I missed the widow of opportunity and decided that getting rid of the weeds would be worth temporarily having done brown grass areas. It works really fast. I noticed weed patches dying by the end of the same day that I applied it. I did have some dead grass due to using it in higher temperatures, but once the weeds were gone, I gently raked those areas and have been giving them extra water, and the green in coming back. I think that the bottle could be better designed. Its not very ergonomic. Overall, I am very satisfied with the results of Image Southern Lawn Weed Killer, and plan to make it part of my fall and spring lawn care routine.
review_lower: [this review was collected as part of a promotion.] i live in texas, and its a battle to keep drought-tolerant st. augustine grass healthy and weed free. image herbicide consumer concentrate southern lawn weed killer for st. augustinegrass and centipedegrass. its designed to kill dandelion, chickweed, clover, dollarweed and spurge. my lawn has had problems with the first three that i listed. its concentrated, so its important to thoroughly read the extensive directions. the 32 fl. oz. bottle covers 5000 sq. feet. so heres the most important thing that i learned, if you want to kill the weeds and not damage your lawn, it can only be applied in cooler months when the temperature is no higher than 85 degrees fahrenheit. i missed the widow of opportunity and decided that getting rid of the weeds would be worth temporarily having done brown grass areas. it works really fast. i noticed weed patches dying by the end of the same day that i applied it. i did have some dead grass due to using it in higher temperatures, but once the weeds were gone, i gently raked those areas and have been giving them extra water, and the green in coming back. i think that the bottle could be better designed. its not very ergonomic. overall, i am very satisfied with the results of image southern lawn weed killer, and plan to make it part of my fall and spring lawn care routine.
